title: Poland and Germany PPC and trade

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Poland and Germany are trading partners. Both countries have the same amount of resources and can produce potatoes and/or lumber. The table below shows the maximum number of units of potatoes or lumber that can be produced by each country. Assume constant opportunity costs in both countries.

Potatoes
 Lumber

Poland

Germany
 <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Assume that prior to trade, Germany is producing <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units of potatoes and <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units of lumber. What can you conclude about the use of resources in Germany? Explain using the production possibilities curve model.

(b) Which country has the comparative advantage in the production of lumber? Explain using numbers.

(c) Now assume each country specializes in the production of the good in which it has a comparative advantage, and the terms of trade are <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> unit of potatoes for <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units of lumber. Are these mutually beneficial terms of trade? Explain.

(d) Suppose the maximum production of potatoes in Poland increases. How will this affect Poland’s opportunity cost of producing lumber? Explain.

(e) Assume Germany’s civilian working-age population is <math alttext="100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, the labor force participation rate in Germany is <math alttext="80%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the unemployment rate is <math alttext="5%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Calculate the number of employed people in Germany. Show your work.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.
